ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.
M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: The event name for which the data was collected
How many times per week does your child yell when he or she is upset?
When would you say the problems with your child's temper began?
Was there a time in the past year when your child did not lose his or her temper at all for 3 months or longer?
In the past year, in which situations has your child lost their temper:Others Places
In the past year, in which situations has your child lost their temper:With Family
In the past year, in which situations has your child lost their temper:With Friends
In the past year, in which situations has your child lost their temper:At School
How many times per week does your child kick or punch people or things when he or she is upset?
How many times per week does your child throw things when he or she is upset?
How many temper outbursts does your child typically have per week?
Has your child had trouble with his or her temper since he or she was young, since before your child was 10?
